intro: Drabella, commonly known as the bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It consists of about 100 species, most of which are native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves and are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Drabella species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to a variety of climatic conditions. They are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
